meanings.definition: On or to the side opposite the front or direction of movement.
meanings.sent1: She looked overside to see what was behind her.
meanings.sent2: The car turned overside to avoid the obstacle.
meanings.sent3: The little dog ran overside to chase its tail.
meanings.sent4: His curiosity led him overside into uncharted territory.
meanings.sent5: The child peeked overside to catch a glimpse of the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: Beyond the side or edge of something.
meanings.sent1: The ball rolled overside and disappeared under the couch.
meanings.sent2: She reached overside to grab the fallen book.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scampered overside of the fence to escape the dog.
meanings.sent4: His ideas often ventured overside of conventional thinking.
meanings.sent5: The kite flew overside the garden wall and into the neighbor's yard.

meanings.definition: Over the side of a ship or boat.
meanings.sent1: He leaned overside to get a better view of the dolphins.
meanings.sent2: The sailor accidentally dropped his hat overside.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched overside, watching the waves below.
meanings.sent4: The anchor splashed overside as the ship docked.
meanings.sent5: She tossed the coin overside, making a wish for safe travels.
